verses.verse: ( Saul’s Death Reported to David) ( 90 31:1-6 ;  130 10:1-6 ) וַיְהִ֗י <WH1961> way·hî - אַֽחֲרֵי֙ <WH310> ’a·ḥă·rê After מ֣וֹת <WH4194> mō·wṯ the death שָׁא֔וּל <WH7586> šā·’ūl of Saul, וְדָוִ֣ד <WH1732> wə·ḏā·wiḏ David שָׁ֔ב <WH7725> šāḇ returned מֵהַכּ֖וֹת <WH5221> mê·hak·kō·wṯ from the slaughter אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- of הָעֲמָלֵ֑ק <WH6002> hā·‘ă·mā·lêq the Amalekites וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב <WH3427> way·yê·šeḇ and stayed דָּוִ֛ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ ... בְּצִקְלָ֖ג <WH6860> bə·ṣiq·lāḡ in Ziklag יָמִ֥ים <WH3117> yā·mîm days. שְׁנָֽיִם׃ <WH8147> šə·nā·yim two

וַיְהִ֣י׀ <WH1961> way·hî - בַּיּ֣וֹם <WH3117> bay·yō·wm day הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י <WH7992> haš·šə·lî·šî On the third וְהִנֵּה֩ <WH2009> wə·hin·nêh ... אִ֨ישׁ <WH376> ’îš a man בָּ֤א <WH935> bā arrived מִן־ <WH4480> min- from הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֙ <WH4264> ham·ma·ḥă·neh camp. מֵעִ֣ם <WH5973> mê·‘im ... שָׁא֔וּל <WH7586> šā·’ūl Saul’s וּבְגָדָ֣יו <WH899> ū·ḇə·ḡā·ḏāw clothes קְרֻעִ֔ים <WH7167> qə·ru·‘îm with torn וַאֲדָמָ֖ה <WH127> wa·’ă·ḏā·māh and dust עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- on רֹאשׁ֑וֹ <WH7218> rō·šōw his head וַיְהִי֙ <WH1961> way·hî - בְּבֹא֣וֹ <WH935> bə·ḇō·’ōw When he came אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to דָּוִ֔ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ David, וַיִּפֹּ֥ל <WH5307> way·yip·pōl he fell אַ֖רְצָה <WH776> ’ar·ṣāh to the ground וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃ <WH7812> way·yiš·tā·ḥū to pay him homage.

וַיֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer asked לוֹ֙ Prep│3ms ( lōw) . דָּוִ֔ד 1732 N-proper-ms ( dā·wiḏ) David אֵ֥י 335 Interrog ( ’ê) “ Where מִזֶּ֖ה 2088 Pro-ms ( miz·zeh) ... תָּב֑וֹא 935 V-Qal-Imperf-2ms ( tā·ḇō·w) have you come from? ” וַיֹּ֣אמֶר 559 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·yō·mer) he replied אֵלָ֔יו 413 Prep│3ms ( ’ê·lāw) -. מִמַּחֲנֵ֥ה 4264 Prep-m│N-csc ( mim·ma·ḥă·nêh) camp, ” יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל 3478 N-proper-ms ( yiś·rā·’êl) from the Israelite נִמְלָֽטְתִּי׃ 4422 V-Nifal-Perf-1cs ( nim·lā·ṭə·tî) “ I have escaped

וַיֹּ֨אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer asked. אֵלָ֥יו <WH413> ’ê·lāw ... דָּוִ֛ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ David מֶה־ <WH4100> meh- “ What הָיָ֥ה <WH1961> hā·yāh was the outcome הַדָּבָ֖ר <WH1697> had·dā·ḇār ...? ” הַגֶּד־ <WH5046> hag·geḏ- tell נָ֣א <WH4994> nā “ Please לִ֑י Prep│1cs ( lî) me. ” וַ֠יֹּאמֶר 559 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·yō·mer) he replied. אֲשֶׁר־ 834 Pro-r ( ’ă·šer-) - נָ֨ס 5127 V-Qal-Perf-3ms ( nās) fled הָעָ֜ם 5971 Art│N-ms ( hā·‘ām) “ The troops מִן־ 4480 Prep ( min-) from הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה 4421 Art│N-fs ( ham·mil·ḥā·māh) the battle, ” וְגַם־ 1571 Conj ( wə·ḡam-) - הַרְבֵּ֞ה 7235 V-Hifil-InfAbs ( har·bêh) “ Many נָפַ֤ל 5307 V-Qal-Perf-3ms ( nā·p̄al) fell מִן־ 4480 Prep ( min-) of הָעָם֙ 5971 Art│N-ms ( hā·‘ām) [them] וַיָּמֻ֔תוּ 4191 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3mp ( way·yā·mu·ṯū) and died. וְגַ֗ם 1571 Conj ( wə·ḡam) And שָׁא֛וּל 7586 N-proper-ms ( šā·’ūl) Saul וִיהוֹנָתָ֥ן 3083 Conj-w│N-proper-ms ( wî·hō·w·nā·ṯān) Jonathan בְּנ֖וֹ 1121 N-msc│3ms ( bə·nōw) and his son מֵֽתוּ׃ 4191 V-Qal-Perf-3cp ( mê·ṯū) are also dead. ”

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer asked דָּוִ֔ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ Then David אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... הַנַּ֖עַר <WH5288> han·na·‘ar the young man הַמַּגִּ֣יד <WH5046> ham·mag·gîḏ who had brought him the report ל֑וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) ..., אֵ֣יךְ 349 Interjection ( ’êḵ) “ How יָדַ֔עְתָּ 3045 V-Qal-Perf-2ms ( yā·ḏa‘·tā) do you know כִּי־ 3588 Conj ( kî-) that מֵ֥ת 4191 V-Qal-Perf-3ms ( mêṯ) are dead? ” שָׁא֖וּל 7586 N-proper-ms ( šā·’ūl) Saul וִיהֽוֹנָתָ֥ן 3083 Conj-w│N-proper-ms ( wî·hō·w·nā·ṯān) Jonathan בְּנֽוֹ׃ 1121 N-msc│3ms ( bə·nōw) and his son

וַיֹּ֜אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer replied, הַנַּ֣עַר׀ <WH5288> han·na·‘ar [he] הַמַּגִּ֣יד <WH5046> ham·mag·gîḏ - ל֗וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) - נִקְרֹ֤א 7122 V-Nifal-InfAbs ( niq·rō) “ I happened נִקְרֵ֙יתִי֙ 7136 V-Nifal-Perf-1cs ( niq·rê·ṯî) ... בְּהַ֣ר 2022 Prep-b│N-msc ( bə·har) to be on Mount הַגִּלְבֹּ֔עַ 1533 Art│N-proper-fs ( hag·gil·bō·a‘) Gilboa, ” וְהִנֵּ֥ה 2009 Conj-w│Interjection ( wə·hin·nêh) “ and there שָׁא֖וּל 7586 N-proper-ms ( šā·’ūl) was Saul, נִשְׁעָ֣ן 8172 V-Nifal-Prtcpl-ms ( niš·‘ān) leaning עַל־ 5921 Prep ( ‘al-) on חֲנִית֑וֹ 2595 N-fsc│3ms ( ḥă·nî·ṯōw) his spear, וְהִנֵּ֥ה 2009 Conj-w│Interjection ( wə·hin·nêh) with הָרֶ֛כֶב 7393 Art│N-ms ( hā·re·ḵeḇ) the chariots וּבַעֲלֵ֥י 1167 Conj-w│N-mpc ( ū·ḇa·‘ă·lê) ... הַפָּרָשִׁ֖ים 6571 Art│N-mp ( hap·pā·rā·šîm) and the cavalry הִדְבִּקֻֽהוּ׃ 1692 V-Hifil-Perf-3cp│3ms ( hiḏ·bi·qu·hū) closing in on him.

וַיִּ֥פֶן <WH6437> way·yi·p̄en When he turned around אַחֲרָ֖יו <WH310> ’a·ḥă·rāw ... וַיִּרְאֵ֑נִי <WH7200> way·yir·’ê·nî and saw me, וַיִּקְרָ֣א <WH7121> way·yiq·rā he called out אֵלָ֔י <WH413> ’ê·lāy - וָאֹמַ֖ר <WH559> wā·’ō·mar and I answered, הִנֵּֽנִי׃ <WH2005> hin·nê·nî ‘ Here I am! ’

וַיֹּ֥אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer he asked לִ֖י Prep│1cs ( lî) . מִי־ 4310 Interrog ( mî-) ‘ Who אָ֑תָּה 859 Pro-2ms ( ’āt·tāh) are you? ’ וַיֹּאמֶר 559 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-1cs ( way·yō·mɛr) So I told אֵלָ֔יו 413 Prep│3ms ( ’ê·lāw) him, עֲמָלֵקִ֖י 6003 N-proper-ms ( ‘ă·mā·lê·qî) an Amalekite. ’ אָנֹֽכִי׃ 595 Pro-1cs ( ’ā·nō·ḵî) ‘ I am

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer Then he begged me, אֵלַ֗י <WH413> ’ê·lay ... עֲמָד־ <WH5975> ‘ă·māḏ- ‘ Stand נָ֤א <WH4994> nā ... עָלַי֙ <WH5921> ‘ā·lay over me וּמֹ֣תְתֵ֔נִי <WH4191> ū·mō·ṯə·ṯê·nî and kill me, כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî for אֲחָזַ֖נִי <WH270> ’ă·ḥā·za·nî has seized me, הַשָּׁבָ֑ץ <WH7661> haš·šā·ḇāṣ agony כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- but כָל־ <WH3605> ḵāl still ע֥וֹד <WH5750> ‘ō·wḏ lingers.’ נַפְשִׁ֖י <WH5315> nap̄·šî my life בִּֽי׃ Prep│1cs ( bî) ...

וָאֶעֱמֹ֤ד <WH5975> wā·’e·‘ĕ·mōḏ So I stood עָלָיו֙ <WH5921> ‘ā·lāw over him וַאֲמֹ֣תְתֵ֔הוּ <WH4191> wa·’ă·mō·ṯə·ṯê·hū and killed him, כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî because יָדַ֔עְתִּי <WH3045> yā·ḏa‘·tî I knew כִּ֛י <WH3588> kî that לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō he could not יִֽחְיֶ֖ה <WH2421> yiḥ·yeh survive. אַחֲרֵ֣י <WH310> ’a·ḥă·rê after נִפְל֑וֹ <WH5307> nip̄·lōw he had fallen וָאֶקַּ֞ח <WH3947> wā·’eq·qaḥ And I took הַנֵּ֣זֶר׀ <WH5145> han·nê·zer the crown אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- was on רֹאשׁ֗וֹ <WH7218> rō·šōw his head וְאֶצְעָדָה֙ <WH685> wə·’eṣ·‘ā·ḏāh and the band אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- was on זְרֹע֔וֹ <WH2220> zə·rō·‘ōw his arm, וָאֲבִיאֵ֥ם <WH935> wā·’ă·ḇî·’êm and I have brought them אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to אֲדֹנִ֖י <WH113> ’ă·ḏō·nî my lord. ” הֵֽנָּה׃ <WH2008> hên·nāh here

וַיַּחֲזֵ֥ק <WH2388> way·ya·ḥă·zêq took hold דָּוִ֛ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ Then David בִּבְגָדוֹ <WH899> biḇ·ḡå̄·ḏō of his own clothes וַיִּקְרָעֵ֑ם <WH7167> way·yiq·rā·‘êm and tore them, וְגַ֥ם <WH1571> wə·ḡam did the same. כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- and all הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים <WH582> hā·’ă·nā·šîm the men אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer who [were] אִתּֽוֹ׃ <WH854> ’it·tōw with him

וַֽיִּסְפְּדוּ֙ <WH5594> way·yis·pə·ḏū They mourned וַיִּבְכּ֔וּ <WH1058> way·yiḇ·kū and wept וַיָּצֻ֖מוּ <WH6684> way·yā·ṣu·mū and fasted עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- until הָעָ֑רֶב <WH6153> hā·‘ā·reḇ evening עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- for שָׁא֞וּל <WH7586> šā·’ūl Saul וְעַל־ <WH5921> wə·‘al- and יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן <WH3083> yə·hō·w·nā·ṯān Jonathan, בְּנ֗וֹ <WH1121> bə·nōw his son וְעַל־ <WH5921> wə·‘al- ... עַ֤ם <WH5971> ‘am and for the people יְהוָה֙ <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD וְעַל־ <WH5921> wə·‘al- ... בֵּ֣ית <WH1004> bêṯ and the house יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel, כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî because נָפְל֖וּ <WH5307> nā·p̄ə·lū they had fallen בֶּחָֽרֶב׃ס <WH2719> be·ḥā·reḇ by the sword.

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer inquired דָּוִ֗ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ And David אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- of הַנַּ֙עַר֙ <WH5288> han·na·‘ar the young man הַמַּגִּ֣יד <WH5046> ham·mag·gîḏ who had brought him the report ל֔וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) ..., אֵ֥י 335 Interrog ( ’ê) “ Where מִזֶּ֖ה 2088 Pro-ms ( miz·zeh) ... אָ֑תָּה 859 Pro-2ms ( ’āt·tāh) are you from? ” וַיֹּ֕אמֶר 559 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·yō·mer) he answered. בֶּן־ 1121 N-msc ( ben-) “ I am the son אִ֛ישׁ 376 N-ms ( ’îš) ... גֵּ֥ר 1616 N-ms ( gêr) of a foreigner, ” עֲמָלֵקִ֖י 6003 N-proper-ms ( ‘ă·mā·lê·qî) an Amalekite. ” אָנֹֽכִי׃ 595 Pro-1cs ( ’ā·nō·ḵî) “ I am

וַיֹּ֥אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer asked אֵלָ֖יו <WH413> ’ê·lāw him, דָּוִ֑ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ So David אֵ֚יךְ <WH349> ’êḵ “ Why לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō were you not יָרֵ֔אתָ <WH3372> yā·rê·ṯā afraid לִשְׁלֹ֙חַ֙ <WH7971> liš·lō·aḥ to lift יָֽדְךָ֔ <WH3027> yā·ḏə·ḵā your hand לְשַׁחֵ֖ת <WH7843> lə·ša·ḥêṯ to destroy אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - מְשִׁ֥יחַ <WH4899> mə·šî·aḥ anointed? ” יְהוָֽה׃ <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD’s

וַיִּקְרָ֣א <WH7121> way·yiq·rā summoned דָוִ֗ד <WH1732> ḏā·wiḏ Then David לְאַחַד֙ <WH259> lə·’a·ḥaḏ one מֵֽהַנְּעָרִ֔ים <WH5288> mê·han·nə·‘ā·rîm of the young men וַיֹּ֖אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer and said, גַּ֣שׁ <WH5066> gaš “ Go, פְּגַע־ <WH6293> pə·ḡa‘- execute בּ֑וֹ Prep│3ms ( bōw) him! ” וַיַּכֵּ֖הוּ 5221 Conj-w│V-Hifil-ConsecImperf-3ms│3ms ( way·yak·kê·hū) So [the young man] struck him down, וַיָּמֹֽת׃ 4191 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·yā·mōṯ) and he died.

וַיֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer had said אֵלָיו֙ <WH413> ’ê·lāw to the Amalekite, דָּוִ֔ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ For David דָּמֶיךָ <WH1818> då̄·mɛ·ḵå̄ “ Your blood עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- [be] on רֹאשֶׁ֑ךָ <WH7218> rō·še·ḵā your own head כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî because פִ֗יךָ <WH6310> p̄î·ḵā your own mouth עָנָ֤ה <WH6030> ‘ā·nāh has testified בְךָ֙ Prep│2ms ( ḇə·ḵā) against you, לֵאמֹ֔ר 559 Prep-l│V-Qal-Inf ( lê·mōr) saying, אָנֹכִ֥י 595 Pro-1cs ( ’ā·nō·ḵî) ‘ I מֹתַ֖תִּי 4191 V-Piel-Perf-1cs ( mō·ṯat·tî) killed אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - מְשִׁ֥יחַ 4899 Adj-msc ( mə·šî·aḥ) anointed. ’” יְהוָֽה׃ס 3068 N-proper-ms ( Yah·weh) the LORD’s

וַיְקֹנֵ֣ן <WH6969> way·qō·nên took up ( David’s Song for Saul and Jonathan) דָּוִ֔ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ Then David אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַקִּינָ֖ה <WH7015> haq·qî·nāh lament הַזֹּ֑את <WH2063> haz·zōṯ this עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- for שָׁא֖וּל <WH7586> šā·’ūl Saul וְעַל־ <WH5921> wə·‘al- ... יְהוֹנָתָ֥ן <WH3083> yə·hō·w·nā·ṯān Jonathan, בְּנֽוֹ׃ <WH1121> bə·nōw and his son

וַיֹּ֕אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer and he ordered לְלַמֵּ֥ד <WH3925> lə·lam·mêḏ be taught בְּנֵֽי־ <WH1121> bə·nê- that the sons יְהוּדָ֖ה <WH3063> yə·hū·ḏāh of Judah קָ֑שֶׁת <WH7198> qā·šeṯ [the Song of] the Bow. ( Or be taught the use of the bow; literally be taught the bow) הִנֵּ֥ה <WH2009> hin·nêh ... כְתוּבָ֖ה <WH3789> ḵə·ṯū·ḇāh It is written עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- in סֵ֥פֶר <WH5612> sê·p̄er the Book הַיָּשָֽׁר׃ <WH3477> hay·yā·šār of Jashar: ( Or the Book of the Upright One, commonly cited as Jasher; note that the Song of the Bow that follows is not found in known manuscripts attributed to Jasher.)
